did.unittitle: Rutgert A. Van Brunt estate papers

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize item

did.abstract: The collection consists of the papers pertaining to the estate of Rutgert A. Van Brunt (1761-1818) of New Utrecht, Kings County (N.Y.). The collection appears to have been compiled by the acting executor, John C. Vanderveer. The documents include the probated last will and testament, inventories, receipts, and property disposition agreements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the papers pertaining to the estate of Rutgert A. Van Brunt of New Utrecht, Kings County (N.Y.), now part of the New York City borough of Brooklyn. The collection appears to have been compiled by the acting executor, John C. Vanderveer. The documents include the probated last will and testament (1818), an inventory of the estate (which included enslaved African-Americans), list of articles sold at auction, receipts against the estate, sale of farming tools to Vanderveer, and a quit-claim deed from Abigail Van Brunt to John Vanderveer. There is also a land indenture from an earlier period (1788) between Van Brunt, his wife, and Engelbart Lott and his wife with John Van Der Veer.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Rutgert A. Van Brunt (1761-1818) was a farmer in New Utrecht, Kings County (N.Y.). In 1782, he married Abigail Vanderbilt. Abigail was one of the three executors of Van Brunt's will, along with one of their sons, Jeremiah (born 1791), and Van Brunt's brother-in-law, John C. Vanderveer (ca. 1763-1845) of Flatbush, who was acting executor. Vanderveer was married to Rutgert A.'s younger sister, Elizabeth (1768-1855). Another sister of Rutgert A. was Altje (1771-1862) who married Englebart Lott of Flatlands in 1788. (See Teunis G. Bergen, Genealogy of the Van Brunt Family, 1653-1867, page 50-53.)

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Most of the material is together in one folder. One oversize item is in a separate box.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The material is in the public domain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. William R. Vanderveer, 1941.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society holds several other collections that reference some member of the Van Brunt family. The principal collections are:
Teunis G. Bergen collection of Van Brunt family genealogy papers (call number 1978.157)
Anita Lott Cruikshank collection of Kings County, N.Y., family papers (call number ARC.281)
Van Brunt v. Gifford arbitration judgment (call number 1977.168)
Rutgert Van Brunt survey map of Brooklyn lot at ferry (call number 1974.164)

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed and described by Larry Weimer in 2012.
